label: Description
value: Cotton panel embroidered at one end and up part of the side in pale green silk. Border shows conventionalized geometric designs with stylized trees above.

label: Description
value: Irregular vertical rectangle with significant losses. The Anglo-Japanesque design has an asymmetrical arrangement of seemingly unrelated motifs including columns, potted plants and geometric shapes. Very abraded surface. Printed in dull browns, reds and blues on neutral ground.

label: Provenance
value: From an old house, 2579 Washington Street, San Francisco, California.

label: Description
value: Geometrical and animal designs in white on soft gray-blue ground. Blue and white stripes on all four sides and one horizontal stripe through the center.

label: Description
value: Fragment of a tapestry-woven band with varied zigzag stripe and diamond patterns, in red, yellow, green, black and tan.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton and wool Technique: tapestry weave; 3 sections: a) slit tapestry, b) slit tapestry with non-horizontal wefts and weft wrapping, and c) slit tapestry, use of non-horizontal wefts Label: cotton and wool slit tapestry with some weft wrapping and use of non-horizontal wefts

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Erskine Hewitt

label: Description
value: Two fragments of headbands in tapestry weave.  Red, yellow, green, black and tan.  Part of design has narrow zigzag stripes.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton and wool Technique: tapestry-woven; warp selvage with remains of what may have been a fringe or tassel; 3 sections: a) slit tapestry b) slit tapestry. Use of non-horizontal wefts limited use of wrapping c) slit tapestry, use of non-horizontal wefts; sides: intact, end: one end, warp selvage, with remains of what may have been a fringe or tassel

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Erskine Hewitt

label: Description
value: Part of a human figure holding a stick in his hand. Yellow, blue, green, pink and black on red ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique: plain weave, predominantly warp-face foundation; pattern is discontinuous supplementary wefts interlacing weft-faced plain weave on grouped warps; sides both intact, ends cut; "reinforced tapestry"

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Erskine Hewitt

label: Description
value: Part of a very stylized human figure with bird's mask. Blue, pink and brown on tan background.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool Technique: single interlock 1:1, with subtle use of non-horizontal weft double faced

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Erskine Hewitt

label: Description
value: Horizontal bands filled with starts alternating in dark blue on half tan half natural background and contrasting light and dark values. Red bands between ornamented stripes.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique: rib weave; complementary warps; Section A: Complimentary warps, plain weave with inner wefts; Section B: Transposed warps; Section C: Warp faced plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Erskine Hewitt

label: Description
value: Fragment of a mantle with two wide patterned bands, one brown, one ocher, separated by narrow stripes of solid pink, brown and ochre. The patterned bands are divided into small rectagles by a grid of red, with large star-like stepped motifs in pink, tan and off-white.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool Technique: plain weave with discontinuous weft (slit tapestry)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Erskine Hewitt

label: Description
value: Oblong table cover, cream-colored linen; border embroidered in polychrome silks, light shades. Edged in narrow silk fringe. Design consists of symmetrically curving vines with figures of hunters, hounds, boars, birds and stags. Stitches are satin, darning and running.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, silk Technique: embroidered in satin, darning and running stitches

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Erskine Hewitt

label: Description
value: Fragment of a blouse in stripes of alternating leno and seersucker weave in natural cotton.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Lucy Work Hewitt

label: Description
value: Large brown and tan shoulder bag with a star surrounded by smaller stars. Top of bag is braided.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. Samuel W. Bridgham

label: Description
value: Small fragment of a belt with stars, figures and birds in red on a tan ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool Technique: plain weave with supplementary warp patterning

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. William G. Durant

label: Description
value: Flat square bag with top opening. Black and white strap with plaited ending on either side of opening. Tassels on bottom. All-over design in solid wool of diamonds framing stylized rosettes in green, gray, purple on salmon ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, cotton Technique: cross-stitch embroidery on compound weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Erskine Hewitt

label: Description
value: Wide veil of black blonde in a pattern of large floral clusters at one end. Bordered with scalloped flowerheads in two sizes. Offset diagonal sprigs cover the field.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: needlework on net

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. James A. Aborn

label: Description
value: Small sampler consisting of horizontal stripes in various designs. Fringes on both ends.

label: Description
value: A wide rim with turned-over edge runs around a shallow dish with raised central boss. Scrolled cartouches are engraved with scenes from the chase and the Bible. In a round central medallion, a scrolled shield flanked by standing angels. Borders of bound fillets, interlacing lines and scrolling. Back fully engraved with foliation and a guilloche about shoulder. Engraved with name: Daniel D. Hanna.

label: Provenance
value: Irwin Untermyer, Esq.; 1949: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Deep round dish with narrow shallow rim; bottom decorated with repoussé design. About a small raised central boss surrounded by a band of illegible lettering, five onion-shaped petals spring outward, separating five lion masks facing outward from whose mouth spring three stems, the central stem terminating in a bunch of conventionalized grapes, the flanking ones terminating in a grape leaf and volute.

label: Provenance
value: Irwin Untermyer, Esq.; 1949: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Red and blue floral paper on a white ground in the style of an "Indian printed" with a border attached. Might have been printed from textile block. Border is simulation of lace drapery.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. Gustav E. Kissel

label: Notes
value: Red and blue floral paper on a white ground in the style of an "Indian printed" with a border attached. Might have been printed from textile block. Border is simulation of lace drapery.
Bible House, Cooper Institute, Thompkins Market for D. T. Valentine's Manual

label: Description
value: Street scene with view of buildings; horse and carriages and pedestrians going by. Printed in lower margin: THE BIBLE-HOUSE, - COOPER INSTITUTE, - TOMPKINS MARKET.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Sarah Cooper Hewitt

label: Description
value: Figure of a Chinese man beating cotton on a broad, flat table. He is shown facing right in profile. Chinese characters in upper left.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor on mulberry paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. Gustav E. Kissel

label: Description
value: A white porcelain covered dish with a basket textured exterior. The covered dish has basket textured handles and an acorn knob.

label: Description
value: A white porcelain covered dish with a basket textured exterior. The covered dish has basket textured handles and an acorn knob.

label: Description
value: An orange and red toned circular plate with a thin branch in the foreground and a brown and white bird flying behind it. Reverse: solid red-brown glaze.

label: Description
value: Cherub with outstretched arms, one leg forward, head facing to his right. Painted accents on wings. .

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle of brass, having stemmed leaves painted green, and twelve glass "diamonds" set in prongs. Small brass spheres for feet. Tin sheet for back with brass rod for support.

label: Description
value: Sash of interlaced wool in pattern suggesting arrowhead. Known as 'ceinture flêche'.

label: Description
value: Short cylindrical cup (a) with loop handle; gray-white ground decorated with polychrome-painted oval scene showing classical ruin of building wall with arches; thin gilt border around oval; rim with underglaze blue band between two thin gilt lines; three incised concentric lines around base. Circular saucer (b) with gray-white ground decorated with central circular medalion surrounded by thin gilt border, showing classical ruin of wall with columns in landscape; rim with underglaze blue band between two thin gilt bands.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D (a: cup): 6.5 x 8.1 x 6.1 cm (2 9/16 x 3 3/16 x 2 3/8 in.) H x W (a,b: overall): 7.3 x 13 cm (2 7/8 x 5 1/8 in.) H x diam. (b: saucer): 2 x 13 cm (13/16 x 5 1/8 in.)

label: Provenance
value: 1949: acquired by Museum from Anonymous donor

label: Description
value: Short cylindrical cup (a) with loop handle; gray-white ground decorated with underglaze-painted oval medallion showing  view of walled city along riverbank; rim with underglaze blue band between two thin gilt lines; three incised concentric lines around base; handle with gold "U" and dots. Circular saucer (b) with gray-white ground decorated circular central medalion showing view of walled cities on water; rim with underglaze blue band between two thin gilt bands.

label: Provenance
value: 1949: acquired by Museum from Anonymous donor

label: Description
value: Cherub with outstretched arms, one leg forward, head facing to his right.  Pained wings.
